isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - INSTALL - CAB DOOR GLASS

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Door Glass with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: From outside cab door (Item 1), position cab door glass (Item 2) in cab door glass opening (Item 3), driver side shown.

Lower cab door glass (Item 2) in cab door glass opening (Item 3) between inner and outer cab door (Item 1). Make sure cab door glass slides into both front and rear cab door glass run channels of the modular door hardware assembly, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 142 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lower cab door glass (Item 4) down to bottom of cab door (Item 2), driver side shown. Modular door hardware assembly removed for clarity.

Check cab door glass seal and inner belt (Item 1) for damage, if damaged replace it. Position cab door glass seal and inner belt over inner lower flange of cab door (Item 2) and push it down on the inner cab door flange, driver side shown.

Check cab door glass seal and outer belt (Item 3) for damage, if damaged replace it. Position cab door glass seal and outer belt over outer lower flange of cab door (Item 2) and push it down on the outer cab door flange, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 142. Cab Door Glass Seal and Inner and Outer Belt

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND INNER BELT
3. CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND OUTER BELT

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Check cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) for damage, if damaged replace it. Position right side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) in the proper position at the cab door (Item 2) and push it into place, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 143. Cab Door Glass Seal and Run Channel

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. RIGHT SIDE OF CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND RUN CHANNEL

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 144 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position the top of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) in the proper position at the cab door (Item 2) and push it into place. Then position left side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 3) in the proper position at the cab door and push it into place, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 144. Cab Door Glass Seal and Run Channel

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. TOP OF CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND RUN CHANNEL
3. LEFT SIDE OF CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND RUN CHANNEL

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 39
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Working through the cab door access opening (Item 5), carefully push window regulator arm (Item 7) into the cab door window slide block (Item 9) in the cab door window slide rail (Item 10), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 39
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
If vehicle is equipped with electric door window, temporarily hold front cab door trim panel (Item 4) up to the cab door (Item 2) and connect electric connectors (Item 3, Figure 35)
and use electric window switch panel (Item 3) to raise and lower cab door glass (Item 1) in the cab door. Make sure cab door glass goes up and down smoothly without binding before continuing. Once it is determined the cab door glass goes up and down properly, disconnect electric connector from electric window switch panel in cab door trim panel and continue to next step, driver side shown.

Install cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For installing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Install Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Install cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Install Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.
Repeat procedure to install passenger side cab door glass.

svcsubproc.para:

for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: From outside cab door (Item 1), position cab door glass (Item 2) in cab door glass opening (Item 3), driver side shown.

Lower cab door glass (Item 2) in cab door glass opening (Item 3) between inner and outer cab door (Item 1). Make sure cab door glass slides into both front and rear cab door glass run channels of the modular door hardware assembly, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para:

for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lower cab door glass (Item 4) down to bottom of cab door (Item 2), driver side shown. Modular door hardware assembly removed for clarity.

Check cab door glass seal and inner belt (Item 1) for damage, if damaged replace it. Position cab door glass seal and inner belt over inner lower flange of cab door (Item 2) and push it down on the inner cab door flange, driver side shown.

Check cab door glass seal and outer belt (Item 3) for damage, if damaged replace it. Position cab door glass seal and outer belt over outer lower flange of cab door (Item 2) and push it down on the outer cab door flange, driver side shown.

step1.para: Check cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) for damage, if damaged replace it. Position right side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) in the proper position at the cab door (Item 2) and push it into place, driver side shown.

step1.para: Position the top of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) in the proper position at the cab door (Item 2) and push it into place. svcsubproc.para:

step1.para: Working through the cab door access opening (Item 5), carefully push window regulator arm (Item 7) into the cab door window slide block (Item 9) in the cab door window slide rail (Item 10), driver side shown.

If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 1) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 2) and raise and lower cab door glass (Item 3) in the cab door (Item 4). Make sure cab door glass goes up and down smoothly without binding before continuing. Once it is determined the cab door glass goes up and down properly, remove window regulator handle and continue to next step, driver side shown.

Install cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For installing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Install Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Install cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Install Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.
Repeat procedure to install passenger side cab door glass.
